conclusion: Analyze forces on plank and block to determine condition for F1 for upward motion.
Define forces: F1 (horizontal), F2 (vertical), f (friction), N (normal), g (gravity).
Net vertical force on block must be upward: F2 > f + mg.
Frictional force f is given by f = Î¼N.
Normal force N is equal to F1 since no horizontal acceleration.
Substitute f into vertical force equation: F2 > 0.20 F1 + 8.
Plank moves upward if vertical component of block's motion overcomes plank's weight.
F2 must be greater than Mg + 0.20 F1 for plank to move upward.
Final condition for F1: F1 > 20 N.
